CatDescriptText: Joseph Hampton, 1847 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "I don't think that there would be less. The man is naturally the head of the family and the kids will listen to the father more than the mother because the father won't play with them as much."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Hampton wearing herringbone coat, multicolored plaid scarf, dark pinstriped suit jacket, eyeglasses, and dark hat, standing in front of patterned granite facade
